result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Oliver Lopez Jimenez in court.  Attorney Joshua Patrick Grube in court for Oliver Lopez Jimenez.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Laura Salicido Blancas in court and previously sworn by the clerk.  Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Cash to be returned to poster.

Defendant Oliver Lopez Jimenez in court.  Attorney Joshua Patrick Grube in court for Oliver Lopez Jimenez.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter St. John in court sworn by clerk. Motion to Modify bond by Attorney Grube argument. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Not guilty plea entered by counsel. Speedy trial rights reserved. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. ***$1500 cash to be returned to poster. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Defendant Oliver Lopez-Jimenez in court. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State. Interpreter Arteaga previously sworn. Bond remains. State needs more time to make charging decision. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

DEFENDANT MUST POST $1500 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.H.H. OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
